generators.name: substituteClade
generators.description: Substitute a clade in a tree with a given node and time, as well as the label of the clade root node. The original child clade would be replaced by the give tree.

arguments.name: baseTree
arguments.description: the tree that we are going to add another tree onto.

arguments.name: cladeTree
arguments.description: the tree that we are going to add it on the base tree

arguments.name: node
arguments.description: the node with the branch that the branch tree would be add on to.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: the mutation happen time that the branch tree would be add onto the base tree

arguments.name: nodeLabel
arguments.description: the name of added branch node.

generators.name: select
generators.description: A function to select a value if the indicator is true, or return 0 otherwise.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: the value.

arguments.name: indicator
arguments.description: indicator for whether the number should be selected, or replace with zero

generators.name: ExpansionPopFunc
generators.description: Models population using a piecewise constant-exponential function with optional NA and I_na.

arguments.name: NA
arguments.description: Ancestral population size.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: Exponential decay rate.

arguments.name: NC
arguments.description: Population size for [0, x].

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: Time boundary x.

arguments.name: I_na
arguments.description: Indicator for NA usage (0 or 1).

generators.name: Categorical
generators.description: The categorical distribution.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability distribution over integer states 1 to K.

generators.name: NegativeBinomial
generators.description: It uses the Pascal distribution with the given number of successes (integer) and probability of success.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: the number of successes.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability of a success.

generators.name: binaryDataType
generators.description: The binary data type.

generators.name: Beta
generators.description: The beta probability distribution.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the first shape parameter.

arguments.name: beta
arguments.description: the second shape parameter.

generators.name: logisticPopFunc
generators.description: Models population growth using a logistic growth function, with optional ancestral population size (NA) and indicator (I_na).

arguments.name: t50
arguments.description: The logistic midpoint (inflection point).

arguments.name: nCarryingCapacity
arguments.description: Carrying capacity (K).

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: Logistic growth rate.

arguments.name: NA
arguments.description: Ancestral population size (optional).

arguments.name: I_na
arguments.description: Indicator for using NA (0 or 1).

generators.name: slice
generators.description: A function to slice a subarray from an array.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: start index

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: end index

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: array to retrieve element of

generators.name: gompertzPopFunc_t50
generators.description: Constructs a GompertzPopulation_t50 model with optional NA and an I_na indicator.

arguments.name: t50
arguments.description: Time when population is half of carrying capacity.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: Growth rate parameter (>0).

arguments.name: NInfinity
arguments.description: Carrying capacity NInfinity (>0).

arguments.name: NA
arguments.description: Ancestral population size (>=0).

arguments.name: I_na
arguments.description: Indicator (0 or 1). If 1 and NA>0 => use NA.

generators.name: concatArray
generators.description: A function to concatenate two arrays into one.

arguments.description: array 1.
array 2.

generators.name: hammingWeight
generators.description: The sum of the true elements of the given boolean array

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: the boolean array to sum the elements of.

generators.name: simulate
generators.description: The function to simulate data from a given lphy script.

arguments.name: lphy
arguments.description: the file path of the lphy script to simulate data.

arguments.name: seed
arguments.description: the seed (integer).

arguments.name: outDir
arguments.description: the directory to output the simulated values. Default to the parent directory of the given lphy script.

generators.name: taxa
generators.description: A set of taxa with species and ages defined in parallel arrays.

arguments.name: names
arguments.description: an array of objects representing taxa names

arguments.name: species
arguments.description: an array of objects representing species names

arguments.name: ages
arguments.description: the ages of the taxa

generators.name: extractTrait
generators.description: return a trait alignment, which contains the set of traits extracted from taxa names.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the set of taxa whose names contain the traits.

arguments.name: sep
arguments.description: the substring to split the taxa names, where Java regular expression escape characters will be given no special meaning.

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: i (>=0) is the index to extract the trait value.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: the map containing optional arguments and their values for reuse.

generators.name: DirichletMultinomial
generators.description: The dirichlet multinomial distribution.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: event probabilities.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: overdispersion parameter of Dirichlet multinomial distribution.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of trials.

generators.name: gtr
generators.description: The GTR instantaneous rate matrix. Takes relative rates and base frequencies and produces an GTR rate matrix.

arguments.name: rates
arguments.description: the relative rates of the GTR process.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the rate of substitution.

generators.name: WeightedDirichlet
generators.description: The scaled dirichlet probability distribution. The weighted mean of values must equal to the expected weighted mean (default to 1).

arguments.name: conc
arguments.description: the concentration parameters of the scaled Dirichlet distribution.

arguments.name: weights
arguments.description: the relative weight parameters of the scaled Dirichlet distribution.

arguments.name: mean
arguments.description: the expected weighted mean of the values, default to 1.

generators.name: labelClade
generators.description: Find the most recent common ancestor of given taxa names in the tree and give it a label.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree to label

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the root of the taxa names would be labelled

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: the label

generators.name: bSiteModel
generators.description: Returns the site model for the given parameters.

arguments.name: Q
arguments.description: the instantaneous rate matrix.

arguments.name: siteRates
arguments.description: raw site rates.

arguments.name: pInv
arguments.description: the proportion of invariable sites parameter

arguments.name: useSiteRates
arguments.description: true if the site rates have heterogeneity.

arguments.name: usePInv
arguments.description: true if the proportion invariable used.

generators.name: SimFossilsPoisson
generators.description: A tree with fossils added to the given tree at rate psi.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: Tree to add simulated fossils to.

arguments.name: psi
arguments.description: The fossilization rate per unit time per lineage.

generators.name: LogNormal
generators.description: The log-normal probability distribution.

arguments.name: meanlog
arguments.description: the mean of the distribution on the log scale.

arguments.name: sdlog
arguments.description: the standard deviation of the distribution on the log scale.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: optional parameter to shift entire distribution by an offset. default is 0.

generators.name: ifelse
generators.description: Return the 1st value if the condition is true, else return the 2nd value.

arguments.description: the logical condition to determine which value to return
the value to return if the condition is true
the value to return if the condition is false

generators.name: gompertzPopFunc_f0
generators.description: Constructs a Gompertz population model (f0-parameterized) with optional NA and indicator I_na.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: Gompertz growth rate (b).

arguments.name: N0
arguments.description: Initial population size (N0).

arguments.name: f0
arguments.description: Initial proportion, f0 = N0 / NInfinity.

arguments.name: NA
arguments.description: Ancestral population size (NA).

arguments.name: I_na
arguments.description: Indicator (0 or 1) controlling usage of NA.

generators.name: localBranchRates
generators.description: A function that returns branch rates for the given tree, indicator mask and raw rates. Each branch takes on the rate of its node index if the indicator is true, or inherits the rate of its parent branch otherwise.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree.

arguments.name: indicators
arguments.description: a boolean indicator for each node except the root. True if there is a new rate on the branch above this node, false if the rate is inherited from the parent node.

arguments.name: rates
arguments.description: A rate for each node in the tree (except root). Only those with a corresponding indicator are used.

generators.name: Poisson
generators.description: The probability distribution of the number of events when the expected number of events is lambda, supported on the set { 0, 1, 2, 3, ... }.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: the expected number of events.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: optional parameter to add a constant to the returned result, default is 0

arguments.name: min
arguments.description: optional parameter to specify a condition that the number of events must be greater than or equal to this mininum, default is 0.

arguments.name: max
arguments.description: optional parameter to specify a condition that the number of events must be less than or equal to this maximum

generators.name: unique
generators.description: the unique set of the array

arguments.name: arg
arguments.description: the string array to find its unique set.

generators.name: RandomBooleanArray
generators.description: Samples a random boolean array of given length and given hamming weight. The hamming weight is the number of true values in the array and must be less than or equal to the length.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: the length of the boolean array to be generated.

arguments.name: hammingWeight
arguments.description: the number of true values in the boolean array.

generators.name: rmTaxa
generators.description: Remove a set of taxa from the given alignment.

arguments.name: names
arguments.description: an array of objects representing taxa names

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

generators.name: CoalescentPopFunc
generators.description: The Kingman coalescent with serially sampled data. (Rodrigo and Felsenstein, 1999)

arguments.name: popFunc
arguments.description: the population size.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of taxa.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: Taxa object, (e.g. Taxa or Object[])

arguments.name: ages
arguments.description: an array of leaf node ages.

generators.name: Weibull
generators.description: The Weibull distribution.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the first shape parameter of the Weibull distribution.

arguments.name: beta
arguments.description: the second shape parameter of the Weibull distribution.

generators.name: informativeSites
generators.description: Return the array of site indices (start from 0), at the given alignment, which parsimony informative sites.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

arguments.name: ignoreUnknown
arguments.description: If true (as default), ignore the unknown state '?' (incl. gap '-'), when determine parsimony informative sites.

generators.name: localClock
generators.description: Apply local clock in a phylogenetic tree to generate a tree with branch rates. The order of elements in clades and cladeRates array should match. The clades should not be overlapped with each other.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree used to calculate branch rates

arguments.name: clades
arguments.description: the array of the node names

arguments.name: cladeRates
arguments.description: the array of clade rates

arguments.name: rootRate
arguments.description: the root rate of the tree

arguments.name: includeStem
arguments.description: whether to include stem of clades, defaults to true

generators.name: Geometric
generators.description: The probability distribution of the number of failures before the first success given a fixed probability of success p, supported on the set { 0, 1, 2, 3, ... }.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability of success.

generators.name: sum
generators.description: Sums over an axis of the 2d array

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: the 2d array to sum the elements of.

arguments.name: axis
arguments.description: the axis over which the array is summed: axis=0 for sum by column, axis=1 for sum by row. Defaults to axis=1 (row summation).

generators.name: bSiteRates
generators.description: the site rates for the given bModelTest parameters.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.description: the shape parameter of the discretized Gamma distribution.

arguments.name: ncat
arguments.description: the number of categories of the discretized Gamma distribution.

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: the number of sites to simulate.

arguments.name: proportionInvariable
arguments.description: the proportion of invariable sites parameter

arguments.name: useShape
arguments.description: true if the non-zero site rates follow a discretized Gamma distribution.

arguments.name: useProportionInvariable
arguments.description: true if there is a proportion of invariable sites.

generators.name: fasta
generators.description: A function that returns an alignment which can be saved as a fasta file later using lphy studio or slphy.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the lphy alignment that is written into the fasta file.

generators.name: SampleBranch
generators.description: Randomly sample a branch among the branches at a given age in the given tree, represented by the node attached to this branch. The function is deterministic when there is only one branch at the given age. The branch is represented by the node under it.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the full tree to sample branch from.

arguments.name: age
arguments.description: the age that branch would sample at.

generators.name: generalTimeReversible
generators.description: The general time reversible instantaneous rate matrix. Takes relative rates and base frequencies and produces an general time reversible rate matrix.

arguments.name: rates
arguments.description: the relative rates of the GTR process.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

generators.name: nucleotideModel
generators.description: The instantaneous rate matrix. Takes relative rates and base frequencies and produces an GTR rate matrix.

arguments.name: modelSet
arguments.description: The set of models to choose from. Valid value are: allreversible, transitionTransversionSplit, namedSimple, namedExtended.

arguments.name: modelIndicator
arguments.description: the index of the model to be employed

arguments.name: rates
arguments.description: the relative rates of the GTR process.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the rate of substitution.

generators.name: setDifference
generators.description: Computes the difference between two arrays. The first parameter is the main set, and the second is the set of elements to subtract. Elements in the second set that are not found in the first set are ignored.

arguments.name: mainSet
arguments.description: the primary set of elements from which to exclude

arguments.name: excludeSet
arguments.description: the set of elements to be excluded from the main set

generators.name: binaryCovarion
generators.description: The rate matrix of the Covarion model for Binary data. It is equivalent to the BEAST mode.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the rate of evolution in slow mode.

arguments.name: s
arguments.description: the rate of flipping between slow and fast modes

arguments.name: vfreq
arguments.description: the frequencies of the visible states

arguments.name: hfreq
arguments.description: the frequencies of the hidden rates

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the mean rate of the process. default = 1.0

generators.name: get
generators.description: Get the value from a map given a string ID as the key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: the key of the map as String

arguments.name: map
arguments.description: the map

generators.name: selectSites
generators.description: Select the site where the fraction of unknown states are less than the threshold in that site.

arguments.name: unknownFracLess
arguments.description: the threshold to select a site, if the fraction of unknown states (incl. gap) in this site is less than the threshold.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

generators.name: DiscretizeGamma
generators.description: The discretized gamma probability distribution with mean = 1.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.description: the shape of the discretized gamma distribution.

arguments.name: ncat
arguments.description: the number of bins in the discretization.

generators.name: map
generators.description: A map defined by the argumentName=value pairs of its arguments.

generators.name: PhyloCTMC
generators.description: The phylogenetic continuous-time Markov chain distribution. A sequence is simulated for every leaf node, and every direct ancestor node with an id.(The sampling distribution that the phylogenetic likelihood is derived from.)

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the time tree.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: the clock rate. Default value is 1.0.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the root probabilities. Optional parameter. If not specified then first row of e^{100*Q) is used.

arguments.name: Q
arguments.description: the instantaneous rate matrix.

arguments.name: siteRates
arguments.description: a rate for each site in the alignment. Site rates are assumed to be 1.0 otherwise.

arguments.name: branchRates
arguments.description: a rate for each branch in the tree. Original branch rates are used if rates not given. Branch rates are assumed to be 1.0 otherwise.

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: length of the alignment

arguments.name: dataType
arguments.description: the data type used for simulations, default to nucleotide

arguments.name: root
arguments.description: root sequence, defaults to root sequence generated from equilibrium frequencies.

generators.name: setUnion
generators.description: Set the union of two given sets and remove all repeat elements.

arguments.name: firstSet
arguments.description: the first set to put in the final set

arguments.name: secondSet
arguments.description: the second set to put in the final set

generators.name: lewisMK
generators.description: The LewisMK Q matrix construction function. Takes a mean rate and a number of states and produces a LewisMK Q matrix.

arguments.name: numStates
arguments.description: the number of states

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the mean rate of the LewisMK process. Default value is 1.0.

generators.name: ExpMarkovChain
generators.description: A chain of random variables. X[0] ~ Exp(mean=initialMean) or X[0] ~ LogNormal(meanlog, sdlog); X[i+1] ~ Exp(mean=X[i])

arguments.name: initialMean
arguments.description: This is the mean of the exponential from which the first value of the chain is drawn.

arguments.name: firstValue
arguments.description: This is the value of the 1st element of the chain (X[0]).

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the dimension of the return. Use either X[0] ~ Exp(mean=initialMean); or X[0] ~ LogNormal(meanlog, sdlog); Then X[i+1] ~ Exp(mean=X[i])

generators.name: rangeInt
generators.description: The range of integers from start to end. Boundaries are included.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: start of the range (inclusive)

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: end of the range (inclusive)

generators.name: CalibratedYule
generators.description: The CalibratedYule method accepts one or more clade taxa and generates a tip-labelled time tree. If a root age is provided, the method conditions the tree generation on this root age.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate, possibly scaled to mutations or calendar units.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the total number of taxa.

arguments.name: cladeTaxa
arguments.description: a string array of taxa id or a taxa object for clade taxa (e.g. dataframe, alignment or tree)

arguments.name: cladeMRCAAge
arguments.description: an array of ages for clade most recent common ancestor, ages should be correspond with clade taxa array.

arguments.name: otherTaxa
arguments.description: a string array of taxa id or a taxa object for other taxa (e.g. dataframe, alignment or tree)

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the root age to be conditioned on optional.

primaryArgument.name: cladeTaxa
primaryArgument.description: a string array of taxa id or a taxa object for clade taxa (e.g. dataframe, alignment or tree)

generators.name: stochasticVariableSelection
generators.description: Models population using different growth models based on the indicator value.

arguments.name: indicator
arguments.description: The indicator for the population model.

arguments.name: models
arguments.description: The array of population models.

generators.name: readDelim
generators.description: A function that loads values from a data delimited file and returns a map.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: the file name including path.

arguments.name: sep
arguments.description: the separator (delimiter) to separate values in each row.

arguments.name: header
arguments.description: If 'header' is true, as default, then use the 1st row as the map keys, otherwise it will create keys and load the values from the 1st row.

arguments.name: comment
arguments.description: The comment character to ignore everything after it in one line. The default is #.

generators.name: Cons_Exp_ConsPopFunc
generators.description: Models population growth using a piecewise exponential growth function with x as an independent parameter.

arguments.name: tau
arguments.description: Time before which population size is constant.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The exponential growth rate.

arguments.name: NC
arguments.description: Current population size after time x.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: Time at which the population reaches NC.

generators.name: Normal
generators.description: The normal probability distribution.

arguments.name: mean
arguments.description: the mean of the distribution.

arguments.name: sd
arguments.description: the standard deviation of the distribution.

generators.name: sample
generators.description: The sample function uniformly sample the subset of a given size from an array of the elements either with or without the replacement.

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: 1d-array to be sampled.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: the number of elements to choose.

arguments.name: replace
arguments.description: If replace is true, the same element can be sampled multiple times, if false (as default), it can only appear once in the result.

generators.name: concat2Str
generators.description: A function to concatenate substrings into one sting.

arguments.name: prefix
arguments.description: the prefix substring to concatenate.

arguments.name: suffix
arguments.description: the suffix substring to concatenate.

generators.name: species
generators.description: extract the species from the given taxa object as a new taxa object. Useful to generate a species tree in the multispecies coalescent. The age of each species will be the youngest age of the taxa from that species.

arguments.description: the taxa object from which to extract the species from.

generators.name: extantTree
generators.description: A tree pruned from a larger tree by retaining only the tips at time zero.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the full tree to extract extant tree from.

generators.name: ErrorModel
generators.description: The error model distribution on an alignment.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the false positive probability.

arguments.name: beta
arguments.description: the false negative probability.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the alignment without errors.

generators.name: exponentialPopFunc
generators.description: Models population growth using an exponential growth function with optional NA and I_na.

arguments.name: GrowthRate
arguments.description: Exponential growth rate

arguments.name: N0
arguments.description: Initial population size

arguments.name: NA
arguments.description: Ancestral population size

arguments.name: I_na
arguments.description: Indicator for using NA (0 or 1)

generators.name: UniformDiscrete
generators.description: The discrete uniform distribution over integers.

arguments.name: lower
arguments.description: the lower bound (inclusive) of the uniform distribution on integers.

arguments.name: upper
arguments.description: the upper bound (inclusive) of the uniform distribution on integer.

generators.name: Cauchy
generators.description: The Cauchy distribution.

arguments.name: median
arguments.description: the median of the Cauchy distribution.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: the scale of the Cauchy distribution.

generators.name: standard
generators.description: The Standard data type function. Takes a state count and produces a Standard data type with that number of states.

arguments.name: numStates
arguments.description: the number of distinct states in this data type.

generators.name: RhoSampleTree
generators.description:
A tree sampled from a larger tree by selecting tips at time zero with probability rho.
Conditioned on root age.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the full tree to sample

arguments.name: rho
arguments.description: the probability that each tip at time zero is sampled

generators.name: arange
generators.description: A function to produce an equally space array of doubles. Takes a start value, and stop value and a step value and returns a double array value.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: value of the range to start at (inclusive)

arguments.name: stop
arguments.description: value of the range to stop at (inclusive)

arguments.name: step
arguments.description: the step size

generators.name: copySites
generators.description: Create a new alignment by copying sites from the original alignment. The sites can be duplicated. Use other function to sample or manipulate the site indices.

arguments.name: ids
arguments.description: the array of site indices (start from 0) of the original alignment.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

generators.name: SimFBDAge
generators.description:
A tree of extant species and those sampled through time, which is conceptually embedded in a full species tree produced by a speciation-extinction (birth-death) branching process.
Conditioned on origin age.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: frac
arguments.description: fraction of extant taxa sampled.

arguments.name: psi
arguments.description: per-lineage sampling-through-time rate.

arguments.name: originAge
arguments.description: the age of the origin.

generators.name: Uniform
generators.description: The uniform probability distribution.

arguments.name: lower
arguments.description: the lower bound of the uniform distribution.

arguments.name: upper
arguments.description: the upper bound of the uniform distribution.

generators.name: newick
generators.description: A function that parses a tree from a newick formatted string.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree in Newick format.

generators.name: SimBDReverse
generators.description:
A complete birth-death tree with both extant and extinct species.
Conditioned on (a fraction of) extant taxa.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: The extant taxa that this process are conditioned on

arguments.name: rho
arguments.description: The fraction of total extant species that the conditioned-on taxa represent. The resulting tree will have taxa.ntaxa()/rho total extant taxa.

generators.name: StructuredCoalescent
generators.description: The structured coalescent distribution over tip-labelled time trees.

arguments.name: M
arguments.description: The population process rate matrix which contains the effective population sizes and migration rates. Off-diagonal migration rates are in units of expected migrants per *generation* backwards in time.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: the number of taxa in each population. provide either this or a demes argument.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the taxa.

arguments.name: demes
arguments.description: the deme array, which runs parallel to the taxonArray in the taxa object.

arguments.name: sort
arguments.description: whether to sort the deme array, before mapping them to the indices of the effective population sizes and migration rates. If not, as default, the pop size indices are determined by the natural order of the deme array, if true, then the indices are the order of sorted deme array.

generators.name: Gamma
generators.description: The gamma probability distribution.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.description: the shape of the distribution.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: the scale of the distribution.

generators.name: split
generators.description: A function to split a given string at the regular expressions and return the i'th (starting from 0) substring of the resulting list.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: the string value to extract a substring matching the given pattern.

arguments.name: regex
arguments.description: a regular expression

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: the index (>=0) of the substring to return

generators.name: SNPSampler
generators.description: Sample SNPs with the given alignment by sampling mutation sites using a binomial distribution (size = number of sites).Take haploid alignment only, take the site as ref and randomly sample an alt.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the one sequence alignment

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability of each site to be SNP, deafult to be 0.01

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: the ratio of heterozygousSNPs and non-reference homozygous SNPs, default all SNPs are heterozygous

generators.name: migrationMatrix
generators.description: This function constructs the population process rate matrix. Diagonals are the population sizes, off-diagonals are populated with the migration rate from pop i to pop j (backwards in time in units of expected migrants per generation).

arguments.name: theta
arguments.description: the population sizes.

arguments.name: m
arguments.description: the migration rates between each pair of demes (row-major order minus diagonals).

generators.name: readTrees
generators.description: A function that parses trees from either a Nexus (default) or Newick file.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: the name of Nexus/Newick file including path.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: Nexus or Newick (case-insensitive), default to Nexus.

generators.name: Dirichlet
generators.description: The dirichlet probability distribution.

arguments.name: conc
arguments.description: the concentration parameters of a Dirichlet distribution.

arguments.name: mean
arguments.description: The expected mean per element. By default, the sampled values sum to 1.

generators.name: rep
generators.description: The replication function. Takes a value and an integer representing the number of times to replicate the value. Returns a vector of the value repeated the specified number of times.

arguments.name: element
arguments.description: the element to replicate.

arguments.name: times
arguments.description: the standard deviation of the distribution.

generators.name: InverseGamma
generators.description: The inverse-gamma probability distribution.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the alpha parameter of inverse gamma.

arguments.name: beta
arguments.description: the beta parameter of inverse gamma.

generators.name: NormalGamma
generators.description: The normal-gamma probability distribution.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.description: the shape of the distribution.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: the scale of the distribution.

arguments.name: mean
arguments.description: the mean of the distribution.

arguments.name: precision
arguments.description: the standard deviation of the distribution.

generators.name: Yule
generators.description: The Yule tree distribution over tip-labelled time trees. Will be conditional on the root age if one is provided.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate, possibly scaled to mutations or calendar units.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the number of taxa.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: a string array of taxa id or a taxa object (e.g. dataframe, alignment or tree)

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the root age to be conditioned on. optional.

primaryArgument.name: taxa
primaryArgument.description: a string array of taxa id or a taxa object (e.g. dataframe, alignment or tree)

generators.name: MissingSites
generators.description: The missing data distribution for an alignment.

arguments.name: prob
arguments.description: the probability that the state in a site is changed to the unknown state.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the alignment before data is missing.

generators.name: k80
generators.description: The K80 instantaneous rate matrix. Takes a kappa and produces a K80 rate matrix.

arguments.name: kappa
arguments.description: the kappa of the K80 process.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the mean rate of the K80 process. default 1.0

generators.name: readNexus
generators.description: A function that parses an alignment from a Nexus file.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: the name of Nexus file including path.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: the map containing optional arguments and their values for reuse.

generators.name: jukesCantor
generators.description: The Jukes-Cantor Q matrix construction function. Takes a mean rate and produces a Jukes-Cantor Q matrix.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the rate of the Jukes-Cantor process. Default value is 1.0.

generators.name: Sequence
generators.description: Create one sequence given the length and the probability distribution over each state.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability distribution over integer states 1 to K.

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: length of the alignment

arguments.name: dataType
arguments.description: the sequence type of the alignment

generators.name: sort
generators.description: The sort function sorts an array by increasing (as default) or decreasing order.

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: 1d-array to sort.

arguments.name: decreasing
arguments.description: sort the array by increasing (as default) or decreasing.

generators.name: UCLN_Mean1
generators.description: The uncorrelated lognormal (UCLN) relaxed clock model. Use the clock rate (mu) in PhyloCTMC as the expected mean clock rate.

arguments.name: uclnSigma
arguments.description: The standard deviation of the expected lognormal distribution on branch rates.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: The tree.

generators.name: RandomComposition
generators.description: Samples a random k-tuple of positive integers that sum to n.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the sum of the random tuple.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: the size of the random tuple.

generators.name: pruneTree
generators.description: A tree pruned from a larger tree by retaining only nodes subtending nodes with non-null id's.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the full tree to sample

generators.name: readFasta
generators.description: A function that parses an alignment from a fasta file.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: the name of fasta file including path, which contains an alignment.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: the map containing optional arguments and their values for reuse.

arguments.name: sequenceType
arguments.description: the sequence type for sequences in the fasta format, default to guess the type between Nucleotide and Amino Acid.

generators.name: MultispeciesCoalescent
generators.description: The Kingman coalescent distribution within each branch of species tree gives rise to a distribution over gene trees conditional on the species tree. The (optional) taxa object provides for non-trivial mappings from individuals to species, and not all species have to have representatives. The (optional) numLoci parameter can be used to produce more than one gene tree from this distribution.

arguments.name: theta
arguments.description: effective population sizes, one for each species (both extant and ancestral).

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the number of sampled taxa in the gene tree for each extant species.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the taxa for the gene tree, with species to define the mapping.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: the species tree.

generators.name: nucleotides
generators.description: The nucleotide data type.

generators.name: SubsampledTree
generators.description: Generate a randomly sampled tree using the given sample fractions and clade taxa name arrays from the specified tree. The order of sample fractions corresponds to the order of the name arrays.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the full tree to extract taxa from.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the taxa name arrays that the function would sample

arguments.name: sampleFraction
arguments.description: the fractions that the function sample in the taxa

generators.name: invariableSites
generators.description: Return the array of site indices (start from 0) at the given alignment, which are invariable sites.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

arguments.name: ignoreUnknown
arguments.description: If true (as default), ignore the unknown state '?' (incl. gap '-'), when determine variable sites or constant sites.

generators.name: PhyloBrownian
generators.description: The phylogenetic Brownian motion distribution. A continous trait is simulated for every leaf node, and every direct ancestor node with an id.(The sampling distribution that the phylogenetic continuous trait likelihood is derived from.)

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the time tree.

arguments.name: diffRate
arguments.description: the diffusion rate.

arguments.name: y0
arguments.description: the value of continuous trait at the root.

generators.name: repArray
generators.description: The replication function. Take an array and an integer representing the number of times to replicate the array. Return a vector of the value repeated the specified number of times.

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: 1d-array to replicate.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the times to replicate array.

generators.name: ntaxa
generators.description: The number of taxa in the given taxa-dimensioned value (e.g. alignment, tree et cetera).

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the taxa-dimensioned value.

generators.name: setInternalNodesID
generators.description: Assign IDs to internal nodes of a given tree. Use this to trigger the inclusion of internal node sequences in the simulated alignment generated by PhyloCTMC.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree to set internal nodes id.

arguments.name: internalNodesID
arguments.description: the vector of internal nodes id.

generators.name: AutoCorrelatedLogRates
generators.description:
This parametric distribution generates node-specific log-rates by a Brownian increment process
along the given time tree. The root node has a specified log-rate, and each child node's log-rate
is drawn from Normal( parentLogRate, sigma^2 * dt ), where dt is the time between parent and child.
This leads to an auto-correlated relaxation of the molecular clock across lineages.

generators.name: distance
generators.description: It computes a matrix of pairwise distances from a given alignment using an evolutionary model. If there is a gap or an ambiguous state, it is treated as different from any canonical states.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the alignment (no unambiguous states).

arguments.name: m
arguments.description: the evolutionary model, such as JC96 or p, default to p (Hamming) distance

generators.name: PhyloMultivariateBrownian
generators.description: The phylogenetic multivariate Brownian motion distribution.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the time tree.

arguments.name: diffusionMatrix
arguments.description: the multivariate diffusion rates.

arguments.name: y0
arguments.description: the value of multivariate traits at the root.

generators.name: PhyloOU
generators.description: The phylogenetic Ornstein-Ulhenbeck distribution. A continous trait is simulated for every leaf node, and every direct ancestor node with an id.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the time tree.

arguments.name: diffRate
arguments.description: the variance of the underlying Brownian process. This is not the equilibrium variance of the OU process.

arguments.name: theta
arguments.description: the 'optimal' value that the long-term process is centered around.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: the drift term that determines the rate of drift towards the optimal value.

arguments.name: y0
arguments.description: the value of continuous trait at the root.

arguments.name: branchThetas
arguments.description: the 'optimal' value for each branch in the tree.

generators.name: Bernoulli
generators.description: The Bernoulli process for n iid trials. The success (true) probability is p. Produces a boolean n-tuple.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: the probability of success.

arguments.name: replicates
arguments.description: the number of bernoulli trials.

arguments.name: minSuccesses
arguments.description: Optional condition: the minimum number of ones in the boolean array.

generators.name: extantTaxa
generators.description: Returns the extant taxa from the given taxa object.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the taxa-dimensioned value.

generators.name: FossilBirthDeathTree
generators.description:
A tree of extant species and those sampled through time, which is conceptually embedded in a full species tree produced by a speciation-extinction (birth-death) branching process.
Conditioned on root age and (optionally) on number of *extant* taxa.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: rho
arguments.description: proportion of extant taxa sampled.

arguments.name: psi
arguments.description: per-lineage sampling-through-time rate.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the number of taxa. optional.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: Taxa object

generators.name: SkylineCoalescent
generators.description: The skyline coalescent distribution over tip-labelled time trees. If no group sizes are specified, then there is one population parameter per coalescent event (as per classic skyline coalescent of Pybus, Rambaut and Harvey 2000)

arguments.name: theta
arguments.description: effective population size, one value for each group of coalescent intervals, ordered from present to past. Possibly scaled to mutations or calendar units. If no groupSizes are specified, then the number of coalescent intervals will be equal to the number of population size parameters.

arguments.name: groupSizes
arguments.description: A tuple of group sizes. The sum of this tuple determines the number of coalescent events in the tree and thus the number of taxa. By default all group sizes are 1 which is equivalent to the classic skyline coalescent.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of taxa.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: Taxa object, (e.g. Taxa or Object[])

arguments.name: ages
arguments.description: an array of leaf node ages.

generators.name: aminoAcids
generators.description: The amino acid data type.

generators.name: hky
generators.description: The HKY instantaneous rate matrix. Takes a kappa and base frequencies (and optionally a total rate) and produces an HKY85 rate matrix.

arguments.name: kappa
arguments.description: the kappa of the HKY process.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the total rate of substitution per unit time. Default 1.0.

generators.name: constantPopFunc
generators.description: Models population using a constant population size.

arguments.name: N0
arguments.description: The constant population size.

generators.name: wag
generators.description: The WAG instantaneous rate matrix for amino acid.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the mean rate of the process. default 1.0

generators.name: bModelSet
generators.description: Returns the set of models for the given bModelTest model set name.

arguments.description: the bModelTest model set name. The option includes: allreversible, transitionTransversionSplit, namedSimple, namedExtended.

generators.name: elementsAt
generators.description: A function to extract element(s) from an array by index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: index list

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: array to retrieve element of

generators.name: f81
generators.description: The F81 instantaneous rate matrix. Takes base frequencies and produces an F81 rate matrix.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the base frequencies.

arguments.name: meanRate
arguments.description: the mean rate of the process. default = 1.0

generators.name: BirthDeathSampling
generators.description:
The Birth-death-sampling tree distribution over tip-labelled time trees.
Conditioned on root age.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: rho
arguments.description: the sampling proportion.

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the age of the root of the tree.

generators.name: binaryRateMatrix
generators.description:
The binary trait instantaneous rate matrix. Takes a lambda and produces an instantaneous rate matrix:

    Q = -1  1
          -

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: the lambda parameter of the binary process. Rate of 0->1 is 1, rate of 1->0 is lambda.

generators.name: BirthDeathSerialSampling
generators.description:
A tree of extant species and those sampled through time, which is conceptually embedded in a full species tree produced by a speciation-extinction (birth-death) branching process.
Conditioned on root age and on number of taxa and their ages (Stadler and Yang, 2013).

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: rho
arguments.description: proportion of extant taxa sampled.

arguments.name: psi
arguments.description: per-lineage sampling-through-time rate.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: the number of taxa. optional.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: Taxa object

arguments.name: ages
arguments.description: an array of leaf node ages.

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the age of the root.

generators.name: intersect
generators.description: A function to get intersection between two sets.

arguments.description: set 1.
set 2.

generators.name: AutoCorrelatedClock
generators.description:
This deterministic function calculates the mean substitution rate on each branch
of a phylogeny under an autocorrelated Brownian motion (log-rate) model.
For each parent-child node pair, the average rate is computed via a bridging integral
(the so-called MeanZ approach). Optionally, the average rates can be normalized so that
the time-weighted mean rate over the entire tree is 1.0.

generators.name: length
generators.description: the length of the argument

arguments.description: the array to return the length of.

generators.name: BirthDeath
generators.description:
The Birth-death-sampling tree distribution over tip-labelled time trees.
Conditioned on root age.

arguments.name: diversification
arguments.description: diversification rate.

arguments.name: turnover
arguments.description: turnover.

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the number of taxa.

generators.name: countMigrations
generators.description: The number of single-child nodes in the tree where the 'deme' attribute changes.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree.

generators.name: sumCols
generators.description: Sums over each column of the given array

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: the 2d array to sum the elements of.

generators.name: mrca
generators.description: get the most recent common ancestor from given tree and taxa names.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the tree to look for most recent common ancestor

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: the array of taxa names to look for most recent common ancestor

generators.name: parseInt
generators.description: A function to parse the given string to an integer.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: the string value to parse into an integer.

generators.name: strToDouble
generators.description: Cast string to double.

arguments.description: given a string.

generators.name: SparsePhyloCTMC
generators.description: Simulate random number of mutations on branches along the tree. Variable sites and root sequence are stored to return the alignment.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: the time tree.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: the clock rate. Default value is 1.0.

arguments.name: freq
arguments.description: the root probabilities. Optional parameter. If not specified then first row of e^{100*Q) is used.

arguments.name: Q
arguments.description: the instantaneous rate matrix.

arguments.name: siteRates
arguments.description: a rate for each site in the alignment. Site rates are assumed to be 1.0 otherwise.

arguments.name: branchRates
arguments.description: a rate for each branch in the tree. Original branch rates are used if rates not given. Branch rates are assumed to be 1.0 otherwise.

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: length of the alignment

arguments.name: dataType
arguments.description: the data type used for simulations, default to nucleotide

arguments.name: root
arguments.description: root sequence, defaults to root sequence generated from equilibrium frequencies.

generators.name: FullBirthDeath
generators.description:
A birth-death tree with both extant and extinct species.
Conditioned on age of root or origin.

arguments.name: lambda
arguments.description: per-lineage birth rate.

arguments.name: mu
arguments.description: per-lineage death rate.

arguments.name: rootAge
arguments.description: the age of the root of the tree (only one of rootAge and originAge may be specified).

arguments.name: originAge
arguments.description: the age of the origin of the tree  (only one of rootAge and originAge may be specified).

generators.name: nchar
generators.description: The number of sites in the given alignment.

arguments.name: sites
arguments.description: a site-dimensioned object (e.g. alignment) or an array of site-dimensioned objects.

generators.name: Coalescent
generators.description: The Kingman coalescent with serially sampled data. (Rodrigo and Felsenstein, 1999)

arguments.name: theta
arguments.description: effective population size, possibly scaled to mutations or calendar units.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of taxa.

arguments.name: taxa
arguments.description: Taxa object, (e.g. Taxa or TimeTree or Object[])

arguments.name: ages
arguments.description: an array of leaf node ages.

generators.name: variableSites
generators.description: Return the array of site indices (start from 0), at the given alignment, which variable sites.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: the original alignment.

arguments.name: ignoreUnknown
arguments.description: If true (as default), ignore the unknown state '?' (incl. gap '-'), when determine variable sites or constant sites.

generators.name: Exp
generators.description: The exponential probability distribution.

arguments.name: mean
arguments.description: the mean of an exponential distribution.

generators.name: argi
generators.description: The arg function for reading an integer.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: the name of the integer argument.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: the default value.

generators.name: sumRows
generators.description: Sums over each row of the given array

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: the 2d array to sum the elements of.
